title: Bug 3666CodeCompletion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.
Steps:
1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the code assist end position (until the end of the current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to control the amount of source to replace.
Removing code assist option.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the enclosed class in your IDE.
2. In the bar method, add a parameter to the baz call.
3. Save the file and observe the code changes made by the code assist.
Expected behavior:
The code assist should not modify the parameter of the baz call in the bar method.
The code should remain as follows:
baz(x.foo());
